intro: Cephalaria cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Cephalaria cilicica is often found in mountainous areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
